info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 5:08AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN PERRY...WESTERN GARLAND...SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT... NORTHEASTERN POLK...SOUTHWESTERN YELL AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 507 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fourche Valley to 6 miles east of Muddy Creek WMA to near Mauldin to near Oden to near Opal, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Ida... Mountain Pine... Norman... Oden... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Meyers... Lake Ouachita State Park... Mauldin... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Muddy Creek WMA... Opal... Mimosa... Gravelly... Fourche Valley... Avant... Black Springs... Acorn... Big Fork... Wing... Mt Tabor... TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
